title.narrative: Oxfam OBIS Syrien NGO-call 2022-2023

description.narrative: To increase protection, income opportunities and improving access to WASH. Furthermore, the efforts will aim to support local actors, NGOs and civil society, and provide leadership and skills in supporting the needs among the most vulnerable.
FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

title.narrative: Local civil society actors, in particular youth and women, participate in decisions-making spaces that affect their lives and future

• # of youth and women who participate in the production of reports etc. (L) • # local actors in particular women and youth participate in decision-making spaces at all levels • # of coordination spaces with participation of youth and women to discuss and influencing priorities

target.value: 20 youth and women who participate in the production of reports etc. 130 local actors in particular women and youth participate in decision-making spaces at all levels 8 of coordination spaces with participation of women and youth to discuss and influencing priorities

title.narrative: Vulnerable youth and women have received training and resources for income generating activities and green jobs (L&S)

title.narrative: Vulnerable small-scale farmers have increased access to water for livelihoods (S)

• # of small-scale farmers benefitting from rehabilitated/repaired irrigation systems • # Of small-scale farmers trained in climate-adapted agricultural techniques for increased agricultural production including water rationing and harvesting • #of small-scale farmers have received agriculture toolkits

target.value: 5,500 small-scale farmers (17,500 individuals) benefitting from rehabilitated/repaired irrigation systems
325 most vulnerable small-scale farmers have received agriculture toolkits

title.narrative: Improved access to food, income and livelihoods opportunities for most vulnerable households, in particular women and youth

• % of crisis affected HHs of small-scale farmers with increased food diversification (S)
• % of trained youth and women reporting increased income (S + L)
• % of crisis-affected population with increased availability of bread (S)
Most vulnerable, crisis-affected women, men, girls and boys have improved access to protection and WASH services (S + L)

• % of women and men, girls and boys in target communities who report improved access to protection services (L&S) • % of women and girls, men and boys who report improved MHM knowledge and practice (L&S) • % of women, girls, men and boys with improved access to WASH services (L&S)
Local actors (local authorities, local NGOs and community-based groups) are strengthened to take leadership and respond to needs of crisis-affected populations

• % of people in target areas who report knowledge of and/or benefit from community group initiatives
• % of trained local actors (local authorities, local NGOs and CBOs) who report improved ability to respond to emergent community needs
• % of women and youth participating meaningfully in community-structures and other decision-making spaces
